title: Greek debt crisis sharpens, as US jobs report smashes forecasts â live updates | Business | The Guardian

greek market falls as battle lines are drawn .
us jobs report puts rocket under the dollar .

greece : we do n't agree to deal based on old programme .

documents.title: s & p downgrades greece
text: one last thing : standard and poors has downgraded greece 's credit rating from b to b- .

perhaps not the biggest surprise in the world but in any case , here are the reuters snaps : 06-feb-2015 17:37 - s & p lowers greece sovereign credit rating to b- from b 06-feb-2015 17:42 - s & p - greece long-term rating lowered one notch to b- ' and kept on creditwatch negative 06-feb-2015 17:43 - s & p - liquidity constraints have narrowed timeframe during which greece 's new govt can reach agreement with creditors on a financing programme 06-feb-2015 17:43 - s & p - greece government 's limited cash buffers , approaching debt redemptions to official preferred creditors constrain negotiating flexibility 06-feb-2015 17:44 - s & p -prolongation of talks with official creditors could lead to further pressure on greece 's financial stability in form of deposit withdrawals nicola duke ( @ nictrades ) s & p downgrades greece to b- and says may cut further not behind the curve at all and that really is that .
back on monday .

documents.title: greek concerns leave european markets lower
text: as the battlelines between greek and the rest of the eurozone were drawn ahead of a key eurogroup meeting next week , stock markets slipped back as investors reacted to the uncertainty .
higher than forecast us jobs data provided some support but not enough to drag most european shares into positive territory .

the final scores showed : the ftse 100 finished down 12.49 points or 0.18 % at 6853.44 germany 's dax dipped 0.54 % to 10,846.39 france 's cac closed 0.26 % lower at 4691.03 italy 's ftse mib fell 0.28 % to 20,760.74 but spain 's ibex edged up 0.36 % to 10,573.1 as for greece , the athens market fell by 1.97 % to 803.36 , with the banking sector down 9.8 % on fears about future financing if the country fails to solve its financial problems .
but after several days of a whistlestop tour round europe by the new greek government , the athens market actually rose 11.3 % on the week , while the banks wer up 11.6 % .
over on wall street , the dow jones industrial average is currently up around 44 points or 0.25 % after the us non-farm payroll numbers .
on that note , it 's time to close up for the evening .
thanks for all your comments , and we 'll be back next week .

and some reuters snaps coming out of greece : 06-feb-2015 17:20 - greek government official says greece does not want remaining bailout tranches apart for 1.9 billion euro profit returns from ecb 06-feb-2015 17:22 - greek government official says necessary for greece to be given ability to issue more t-bills to cover any extra needs
more conflicting reports from greece .

helena smith reports : greek media are now reporting that the prime minister 's office is firmly rebuffing suggestions that the government will reject outright accepting any form of extension on the current bailout programme .

given the eurogroup president 's refusal to countenance a bridge loan that could tide the country over until it is able to present it 's own debt reduction proposals , athens may well be reconsidering its options .

officials in the prime minister 's office are being quoted as saying they knew about the emergency eurogroup meeting that will be held next wednesday to discuss greece , and welcome the news and will present analytical plans then .
you may recall that earlier we put a couple of photos of greek finance minister yanis varoufakis on his phone , with my colleague graeme wondering who he was phoning .
well now we have an answer , from the man himself : yanis varoufakis ( @ yanisvaroufakis ) @ graemewearden since you are asking : to my daughter !
( my worst critic )
and more : esm ( @ esm press ) # esm # regling : once qe is implemented by the ecb in march , it will help the euro area economy return to normality .
esm ( @ esm press ) # regling : we 've only issued bonds in ¬ but we 're likely to issue in other currencies .
investors will get wider menu to buy efsf/esm bonds

more eurozone bigwigs coming out with their advice to greece , this time klaus regling , managing director of the european stability mechanism : esm ( @ esm press ) # esm md # regling in interview w/ japan .

newspaper nikkei @ twitterid and nikkei asian review @ twitterid esm ( @ esm press ) # esm # regling : # efsf has disbursed over ¬140bn to # greece , owns 44 % of greek debt , is by far greece 's largest creditor esm ( @ esm press ) # esm # regling : new greek governm/ may want to make some changes but i hope the reform process and fiscal consolidation continues esm ( @ esm press ) # esm # regling : it would be a missed chance if new greek government did not pursue reforms & let progress accomplished go to waste esm ( @ esm press ) # esm # regling : if there is no agreement w/ new greek gov there will be no more money available but it 's too early to judge what will happen .
esm ( @ esm press ) # esm # regling : there was no spillover from greek election to other ¬ countries .
we are now far better prepared for whatever crisis may come .

more from reuters on the us comments on greece : the united states told greece through its ambassador on friday to work cooperatively with its european colleagues and the international monetary fund and that athens needed to push ahead with reforms .
greece should continue to make administrative and structural reforms and exercise fiscal prudence , the embassy said in a statement .
u.s .
ambassador to greece david pearce earlier met prime minister alexis tsipras and senior ministers from the recently elected leftist government .
athens has been seeking support for renegotiating the terms of its international bailout and to end the austerity that is imposed by the eu and imf with it .

meanwhile the us stock market has opened , and despite the futures predicting a hefty double digit rise on the dow jones industrial average after the blowout non-farm payroll numbers , it has n't turned out like that so far .

the dow is currently up just 11 points , as investors speculate the higher than forecast jobs and average earnings figures might prompt the us federal reserve to sanction an interest rate rise sooner than expected .
dr harm bandholz , chief us economist at unicredit research , said : in its latest federal open market committee statement the fed upgraded its assessment of the labor market from solid to strong .
today 's employment numbers unequivocally vindicated this wording change .

given the fact that most fomc members see the plunge in oil prices , which will push inflation rates even lower in the coming months , as a positive for the us economy , we remain convinced that the fed continues to get closer to its first rate hike .
chair yellen 's semi-annual monetary policy report before congress later this month provides her with a good opportunity to prepare markets for further changes in the fed 's rhetoric .

in the wake of the earlier meeting between greek finance minister yanis varoufakis and a delegation from the us treasury , reuters has a snap outlining the view from across the atlantic : 06-feb-2015 14:40 - athens- u.s. says greece must make reforms to meet international obligations , work cooperatively with eu , imf

some confusion surrounding supposed comments from eurogroup president jeroen dijsselbloem : karl stagno-navarra ( @ ksnavarra ) @ j dijsselbloem says # eurozone govts 'wo n't grant # greece short-term financing agreement to keep afloat while renegotiating terms of support dio perix ( @ dioperix ) # eurogroup chief @ twitterid dijsselbloem rules out bridge loan sought by # greece - bloomberg business - # economy # eurozone wolf ( @ wolf pre-weekend posturing by dijsselbloem and athens about bridge loans/bridges .
despite the focus on bridges , neither side is constructive elodie lamer ( @ elodielamer ) # dijsselbloem 's statement on # greece not so clear apparently , not really what he meant , i am told .
he said need to talk the programme first .
cyprus 's bailout programme has also hit a hurdle .
its troika of lenders have been unable to complete their latest assessment of its financial programme , because mps voted last month to suspend a law to help banks to tackle bad debts .
in a statement today , the lenders say that reducing the high level of non-performing loans is essential to restoring growth and job creation in cyprus .
given the further suspension of the effective application of the foreclosure framework , reaching staff-level agreement on the review was not possible during this visit .
the teams look forward to a timely completion of the review as soon as the conditions are in place for a positive conclusion .
rik winkel ( @ rikwinkel ) another troika-acccident waiting to happen .
'no agreement possible ' .
statement on cyprus via @ twitterid commission
athens-based journalist efthimia efthimiou is hearing that the new greek government fears it will collapse if it sticks with the old bailout promises .
efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) acc 2 mof sources , finmin isnt going 2 sign the program in eg coz `` govt will collapse .
will prepare our own program '' # greece via @ twitterid
yanis varoufakis has been working his phone inside the athens parliament today .
/reuters .
giannakouris/ap

documents.title: greek market falls as battle lines are drawn
text: back to greece and the athens stock market has now fallen 3 % as another gust of gloom sweeps through the trading floor .
that follows both sides taking a hard line ahead of next wednesday 's eurogroup meeting .
as covered earlier , the german government wants greece to turn up with a plan to deal with its debt problem , but the greek government says it wo n't accept a deal based on the old bailout .
it mean confrontation is looming yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) # greece gov position in line w pre-election pledges .
syriza never implied they wld blink to eurozone 's positions .
confrontation was obvious .
efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) # greece athens stock exchange -3.32 % now after this reuters story re greece-eurogroup .
it was -0.8 % before that
dorothy ( @ dorothyier ) november nfp revised up to 423k , december revised up to 329k , jan beats estimates .
so far so good .
hike , hike , hike joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) the dollar is still powering higher .

documents.title: us jobs report puts rocket under the dollar
text: the dollar has surged on the foreign exchanges , as traders anticipate that the strong jobs report will prompt a us rate hike within a few months .
us dollar against the japanese yen .
the surprisingly strong jump in average earnings ( +0.5 % month-on-month ) may ease fed chair janet yellen 's concerns over wage growth .
mark dow ( @ mark dow ) janeeeeeeet !
rob carnell of ing says a june rate hike is back in the
instant reaction : matt busigin ( @ mbusigin ) well , that was an unambiguously phenomenal jobs report .

documents.title: blowout us employment report - the details
text: not got a reuters terminal ?
no problem financial acrobat ( @ finansakrobat ) all nfp numbers .
this strong jobs report raises the chances that the us federal reserve is going to start raising interest rates before too much longer .
joseph weisenthal ( @ thestalwart ) booooom
nicola duke ( @ nictrades ) january jump in us jobs largest since nov 2008
the us unemployment rate has inched up to 5.7 % , from 5.6 % , despite the strong job creation over the last three months .
that indicates that more people came back to the labour market , as it strengthens .
pedro da costa ( @ pdacosta ) u.s. economy created 257,000 new jobs in january , unemployment rises to 5.7 %
and it 's a blowout reading on earnings too - average us earnings rose by 0.5 % in january , much stronger than the 0.3 % that analysts had predicted .

documents.title: us employment total rises by 257,000 in january
text: breaking : the us economy created 257,000 new jobs in january , that 's a better reading than expected .
and revisions to december and november 's data has added another 147,000 new jobs .
wow

documents.title: greece : we do n't agree to deal based on old programme
text: newsflash from athens : yanis varoufakis has no intention of agreeing to anything based on the old bailout programme , at next wednesday 's eurogroup .
so says a government official , drawing the battle lines ahead of the extraordinary meeting .

greek finmin varoufakis will not agree to any deal relating to previous bailout programme at next week 's eurogroup - government official greece will ask eurogroup for bridge agreement until it presents overall debt and reform plan-government official greece expects tough stance from eu partners , that they will ask athens to commit to previous agreements , extension of current bailout
ok , it 's nearly time for the final major piece of economic news of the week - the us unemployment report for january .
economists expect that around 234,000 new jobs were created last month .
arguably the average earnings data will be more interesting - it could either boost , or undermine , the odds of the federal reserve raising rates in the coming months .
jamie mcgeever ( @ reutersjamie ) u.s. jobs forecasts per @ twitterid consensus : 234k high : 290k low : 190k unemployment rate : 5.6 % average earnings : +0.3 %
finland 's government has survived a confidence vote over the greek crisis : kati pohjanpalo ( @ pohjanka ) finland 's government prevails in confidence vote as opposition uses greece as cudgel :

documents.title: lunchtime summary
text: as feared , it 's been a quieter day than we 've got used to in 2015 .
# mustn'tgrumble eurozone finance ministers have called an emergency meeting for next wednesday night to discuss the greek crisis .

germany wants athens to turn up with a plan greece 's finance minister , yanis varoufakis , has met with a delegation from the us treasury and reeling from the indignity of not being allowed into the reform club .
zerozero ( @ gary zero ) so varoufakis was refused entry to the reform club .
their loss .
# london # greece # eurozone the athens parliament has elected a new speaker , human rights lawyer zoe konstantopoulou .

varoufakis has also been sworn in : îîºî±î¸ ( @ gath ) -îî³ï ïïî·î½ î¸î­ïî· ïî¿ï î¸î± ïî¿ï î­ïî¹ïî½î± î­î½î± î¬ïîµïîºî±ï ïî¿ï î£ ïî¹î¼ïî » îµ -îïîµ î¼îµ î î¬î½î¿ î´î¹î±î²î¬î¶ï îºî¿î¼î¹ïî¬ïî¹î¿ ïïî¿ îºî¬ïî¹ïî±î » greek bank stocks have dropped , despite its central bank insisting yesterday that the sector was completely safe .
analysts are hopeful that greece and its creditors will agree a deal .

abn amro reckons the two sides are inching closer and goldman sachs warns that the next few days will be crucial : efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) goldman sachs : crucial days for # greece banks as the political situation is set to unfold efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) goldman sachs expects # greece to remain in the euro area although only after a period of potentially intense political tension efthimia efthimiou ( @ efiefthimiou ) gs : the risk of an economic & financial accident has increased , given the more confrontational stance of the new govt # greece while in the uk , the trade gap has widened to a four-year high .

here 's data back to 1870
yanis watch : here 's greece 's finance minister arriving at the finance ministry in athens , to meet senior us treasury official daleep singh and lea bouzis.. pantzartzi/epa
italy 's finance minister , pier carlo padoan , has declared that eurozone finance ministers will aim for a unified position ' on greece at next wednesday 's extraordinary meeting .
that 's via the mni newswire , which reports that padoan also identified political union as the eurozone 's ultimate goal .
yannis koutsomitis ( @ yannikouts ) v interesting statement by padoan .
implies that eurogroup may come up w a unified position towards greece and varoufakis may end up isolated

documents.title: read this ! ( and then this too )
text: the eurozone crisis is a conflict between countries , right ?
wrong !
it 's a conflict between economic sectors .
so says economist michael pettis in a very thought-provoking blog post .
he argues that it 's fundamentally wrong to focus on clashes between rich and poor , or efficient and inefficient , countries .
instead , it 's a class war .

pettis says : in fact , the current european crisis is boringly similar to nearly every currency and sovereign debt crisis in modern history , in that it pits the interests of workers and small producers against the interests of bankers .
the former want higher wages and rapid economic growth .
the latter want to protect the value of the currency and the sanctity of debt .

and there 's a lot of fascinating history to back this up : michael pettis : syriza and the french indemnity of 1871-73 ft alphaville have kicked the tires on the theory too , and point out that german workers have also suffered from this crisis : one of the worst costs for germany has been the lack productivity growth .
for all the talk of teutonic competitiveness , german labour productivity has grown at the meagre pace of just 0.6 per cent per year , on average , since 1998 .
output per hour worked is actually lower now than it was in 2007 .

eurozone productivity alphaville ft alphaville : michael pettis explains the euro crisis ( and a lot of other things , too ) izabella kaminska ( @ izakaminska ) must read summary by @ twitterid c klein of pettis on eurozone , debt forgiveness & how blaming periphery misses the point izabella kaminska ( @ izakaminska ) also , it 's an amazingly refreshing analysis of germany 's role in all this
the reform club shocking news .
greece 's finance minister was apparently refused entry to london 's reform club this week .
the private members club baulked at yanis varoufakis 's open-collar look , even though he was chaperoned by a former chancellor of the exchequer , lord lamont .
the ft 's diary has the story : the greek economist certainly impressed the hedgies and city types he addressed on monday night .
his two-hour speech received a standing ovation ; his flawless english , more eloquent than practically the entire british cabinet , said one person who met him .
not the dogmatic marxist he 's portrayed as .
but not everything went to plan on the visit .
lord lamont tried to give a breakfast for his friend at the reform club , only to find that the perennially tie-less varoufakis was n't allowed in .
lord lamont tells city insider : they would n't accept that his national dress was not a tie .
so they popped around the corner to the less formal sofitel .

it 's not like varoufakis does n't scrub up rather well , either enikos en ( @ enikos en ) rare photo of varoufakis wearing suit and bow tie - ravi mattu ( @ ravmattu ) norman lamont wanted to host greek fin min @ twitterid at the reform club - but they would n't let him in
container ships are unloaded at felixstowe port .
macdiarmid/getty images british exporters have called for more help after the uk trade gap hit a four-year high .

katie allen reports : britain 's trade deficit last year was the widest since the coalition came to power , dealing a blow to the government 's drive to rebalance the economy away from consumer spending .

official figures released on friday , showing a trading deficit for goods and services of â£ 34.8bn in 2014 , will make disappointing reading for the conservative party as it seeks to capitalise on its economic record ahead of may 's election .
despite a vow to revive manufacturing and raise exports , the trade deficit last year was the widest since 2010 as exports fell faster than imports .
the news prompted fresh calls for export support from the british chambers of commerce .

the business lobby group 's chief economist , david kern , commented : we are clearly not making adequate progress in rebalancing our economy , and the weakening of the eurozone is creating problems for our exporters .
much greater efforts are needed to develop a national strategy for boosting exports , with improved access to finance for growing firms .
full story : uk trade deficit widens to four-year high
germany want greece to present a strategy for its debt problems to eurozone finance ministers on wednesday , at the emergency eurogroup meeting announced this morning .
a german finance ministry spokesman told reporters that the berlin government is completely open what will happen after the end of the current bailout programme .
dealingroom ( @ dealingroom en ) jaeger : greece should present plans before a feb. 11 meeting - greece to be topic at g-20 , not on official agenda
heads-up .

a protest rally in support of greece has been called in barcelona tonight : 15mbcn int ( @ 15mbcn int ) solidarity with greek people in # barcelona , against the ecb blackmail to # greece today at 7pm # catalunyaambgrã¨cia
pedestrians walk past the central building of national bank of greece in athens february 6 , 2015 .
tsironis/reuters meetings are about to begin in athens between finance minister yanis varoufakis and team from the us treasury daleep singh , deputy assistant secretary for europe & eurasia .
but both sides will be keeping mum .
helena just spoken to finance ministry , which says there will be no statements afterwards .
finland 's government faces a vote of confidence this lunchtime over the greek debt crisis .
the vote was called by the finns , the anti-bailout party , which demands answers from prime minister alexander stubb over the issue .
yesterday , stubb vowed to help work through the crisis to save the common currency .
alexander stubb ( @ alexstubb ) the sun is shining in # helsinki .
spring in the winter air .
next a vote of confidence on greece .
# politics # eduskunta

zoe konstantopoulou , at the first meeting of syriza mps in the new greek parliament , in 2015 -andra photography/flickr human rights lawyer zoe konstantopoulou has become the youngest politician to hold the post of greece 's parliamentary speaker , and the second woman in close to 200 years .
although konstantopoulou was elected with an unprecedented number of votes , she is not everybody 's cup of tea .
helena explains : the centrist to potami party lambasted syriza for proposing that she stand for the post - one in which diplomatic skills are seen as essential .
instead of choosing an individual that can bring about accord , the perennial protagonist of parliamentary squabbles was selected instead , it said when her nomination was announced last week .
damian mac con uladh ( @ damomac ) # greece 's new parliamentary speaker zoi konstantopoulou , a 38-year-old lawyer elected in central athens for # syriza
back in greece , zoe konstantopoulou has been elected as parliamentary speaker with a record number of votes - 235 , out of 300 mps in total .
diane shugart ( @ dianalizia ) zoe konstantopoulou vows to uphold and enforce parliamentary rules .
ie no more omnibus bills .

it 's official - eurozone finance ministers will gather in brussels next wednesday for a special meeting on the greek crisis [ as flagged up earlier ] jeroen dijsselbloem ( @ j dijsselbloem ) extra # eurogroup on # greece on wednesday 11 feb , start 17.30 in lex-building .

documents.title: greek bank shares hit by bailout fears
text: after a cautious start , greek bank shares have headed south this morning as the uncertainty over its bailout programme hits confidence again .
financial stocks are leading the fallers on the athens market , with national bank of greece shedding over 5 % .

greek stock market fallers , february 06 2015 reuters ian williams of peel hunt says investors are worried by the lack of progress between germany and greece , following yesterday 's press conference in berlin : mr schauble continues to insist greece abide by the troika 's restructuring plans , which seems a very remote possibility given syriza 's express opposition to those arrangements .
compromise is a long way off and the renewed slump in the share prices of the greek banks seems wholly logical .

documents.title: uk trade deficit is widest since 2010
text: so much for rebalancing the uk economy - the trade deficit has hit a four-year high .

ons ( @ ons ) total # trade deficit widened to â£ 34.8bn in 2014 , largest deficit since 2010 when deficit was â£ 37.1bn in december , britain 's trade deficit widened to â£ 2.9bn , up from â£ 1.8bn in november 2014 .
that 's because the uk imported â£ 10.2bn more physical goods than it sold to the rest of the world in december .
services provided a surplus of â£ 7.3bn .
michael hewson ( @ mhewson cmc ) u.k. 2014 goods deficit 120 bln pnds , widest on record
and a secret vote to elect zoe konstantonopoulou , a lawyer by training and one of syriza 's leading lights , as greece 's parliamentary speaker is now underway .
she is expected to easily be catapulted to the post .
helena smith says : i bumped into zoe in corridors of parliament yesterday .
she was excited .
asked if she felt greece was experiencing a historic turning point , she shot back : all the way . '
diane shugart ( @ dianalizia ) parliament now voting for its president aka speaker of the house .
syriza candidate zoe konstantopoulos broadly supported
over in athens , helena smith reports that parliament has just sworn in finance minister yanis varoufakis .
deputy foreign minister in charge of international investment euclid tsakalotos ( who was educated in london [ st paul 's , no less ] before going up to oxford ) , has also been sworn in .

documents.title: eurozone ministers to discuss greece next week
text: sounds like the rumours were true .
two eu officials have told the wsj that eurozone finance ministers will hold a special meeting about greece on wednesday .
that 's one day before european leaders hold a two-day summit .
gabriele steinhauser says : the talks are supposed to free eu leaders , who are meeting in brussels on thursday , from having to delve into the details of greece 's financial problems .
that 's also the day after the new greek government holds its confidence vote , so we 'd know tsipras 's policy plans by then .
marcus walker ( @ mmqwalker ) prediction : greek-german chicken game wo n't be resolved at feb 11 eurogroup/feb 12 summit .
gaps too big .
greek newspapers are dominated , of course , by yesterday 's meeting in berlin .
enikos.gr have rounded up the details : war of nerves is the headline in ethnos referring to the ups and downs of greece 's negotiations as well as the backstage politics taking place .
varoufakis wants 67 % of the existing bailout programme and 33 % reforms , says eleftheros typos .
ta nea says greece is dancing with wolves and is facing pressure and threats to comply with its commitments .
angela merkel 's government is facing its historic responsibility to prove it cares about a european germany and not a german europe , says efimeritha ton syntakton .
enikos en ( @ enikos en ) 'they could n't even agree to disagree ' - greek press review -
the greek parliamentary wheels are turning kathimerini english ( @ ekathimerini ) election of new parliament speaker to begin in a few minutes # greece
traders in athens made a cautious start this morning , pushing the atg index up around 1 % .
bank shares , which have been through a stomach-churning ride in recent days , are inching higher ; eurobank has gained 4 % .
last night , the greek central bank insisted that the country 's financial sector was absolutely safe , with no liquidity problems .
the ft has some good news for greece - apparently the ecb 's governing council was split over wednesday night 's contentious decision to ban the use of greek debt as collateral for cheap loans .
frankfurt correspondent claire jones reports that national central bank chiefs were fairly evenly split but under the rolling voting system greece , cyprus , ireland and france did n't get a vote .
that may indicate that there wo n't be enough support to slam the ecb 's liquidity window shut of greece does n't reach a debt deal by the end of february .
katerina sokou ( @ katerinasokou ) `` @ nickkounis : ft reports ecb was split on banning greek debt as collateral .
reduces risk that ela will be blocked
geopolitical worries have helped to push most european stock markets into the red this morning , with the ftse 100 down around 0.4 % .

european stock markets , early trading , february 06 2015 reuters marc ostwald of adm investors services says the city is worried by the uncertainties which surrounds greece , and the ukraine , which appears to be hurtling out of control on every count .

documents.title: greek crisis : what the columnists say
text: over in the wall street journal , stephen fidler says europe is pondering how much greece really means to them .

one question european policy makers are asking is whether mr. tsipras represents a break to [ greece 's ] clientelistic tradition , or whether he will be guided by the business-as-usual principle that it 's our turn now .
if the former , greece 's eurozone partners may be more inclined to accommodate its requests provided the government signs up to meaningful reform .
if the latter , they may eventually be inclined to take the risk of casting it adrift .

more here : europe weighs the costs of casting greece aside our own nils pratley warns that yanis varoufakis , for all his sweet reasonableness this week , did n't actually achieved much during his dash between around european capitals .
the eurozone 's big beasts seem determined to force a quick resolution , rather than accept syriza 's timetable .
optimists might reflect that germany , as a negotiating tactic , was always going to make the threat of grexit , or greece 's exit from the euro , feel real .
does germany really want to be seen as responsible for driving greece out of the eurozone ?
probably not .
but the pressure being applied on syriza is hard and has arrived , courtesy of the ecb , earlier than expected .
varoufakis has won a few sympathisers on his tour of capitals .
what he and syriza need , however , is out-and-out supporters within the eurozone .
they have n't collected any yet .

more here : greece and varoufakis need supporters not sympathisers while the ft 's man in berlin , stefan wagstyl , may boast a well-stocked film collection : it was not quite ill met by moonlight , the film in which second world war commandos and greek guerrillas help kidnap a wehrmacht general .
but it was nonetheless dramatic when the greek and german finance ministers finally met for a showdown in berlin over the greek debt crisis .
like the best movie stars , wolfgang schã¤uble and yanis varoufakis kept the crowds waiting .

and when they finally appeared at their press conference after two hours of talks it was to announce that they were as far apart as ever on how to refinance athens once its rescue programme expires at the end of this month .
if they agreed on one thing , it was that this particular eurozone thriller still has a long way to run .
more here : showdown in berlin leaves leading actors poles apart

documents.title: abn amro : greek deal may be in sight
text: greece and its lenders may be inching towards a deal , reckons nick kounis , head of macro & financial markets research at abn amro .
here 's a flavour of his research note this morning .
a deal looks to more reachable despite this uncomfortable meeting , a deal has recently become more feasible .
greece previously rejected the idea of a euro-imf adjustment programme .
yet at the press conference , the greek finance minister said that the country was looking at a bridging programme ' to tide it through until a new deal was struck .
he also said he agreed with 70 % of what was in the old programme .
the three elements of a new agreement we think a new deal will have three pillars .
first , a new reform programme , with more emphasis on tackling tax evasion and vested interests , and less on welfare and social spending cuts .
second , debt relief for greece , perhaps in steps , conditional on reform progress .
help on this front was promised to greece in november 2012 by the eurogroup .
third , a lower primary surplus target , which would fit with the lower level of debt and allow less aggressive fiscal consolidation .
all these elements look politically feasible .
he also flags up that greek banks are losing deposits as the crisis intensifies .
amro

yesterday 's press conference between yanis varoufakis and wolfgang schã¤uble made it to the front page of two uk papers this morning : neil henderson ( @ hendopolis ) ft : merkel and hollande in putin talks to break ukraine deadlock # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers neil henderson ( @ hendopolis ) guardian : solution to crisis is in your hands , germans tell greece # tomorrowspaperstoday # bbcpapers

documents.title: us officials visit athens for talks
text: good morning , and welcome to our rolling coverage of the eurozone crisis , the world economy , business and finance .
greece 's whistle-stop tour of european capitals is over , but the clock is still ticking in its push to agree new financing before its bailout programme expires .
finance minister yanis varoufakis returned home last night after that edgy press conference with germany 's wolfgang schã¤uble , without signs of a breakthrough .

greek and german finance ministers clash at debt relief talks so now , attention shifts to athens , where varoufakis will meet with officials from the us treasury today , led by daleep singh , the deputy assistant secretary for europe .
daleep singh , deputy assistant secretary for europe and eurasia at the department of treasury .
treasury prime minister alexis tsipras will be drawing up his policy plans , ahead of a vote of confidence to confirm his government .

that three-day debate is expected to begin on sunday , tsipras may be bolstered by last night 's pro-government demonstration ( a rare sight ) in athens , having made little obvious headway with his fellow european leaders this week .
and this leaves financial analysts fearing another explosion in the eurozone crisis .

stan shamu of ig sums it up : while it seems funding will continue to flow in the near term , there will be fears greece is at risk of plunging into a fresh political crisis should the government not appease the masses with an ideal result from the negotiations .
recent steps also seem to imply european leaders are looking to put more pressure on greece and accelerate the negotiation process .
but after a series of meetings and press conferences in paris , rome , london , frankfurt and berlin , it might ( finally ) be a quieter day .
and hopefully varoufakis has racked up a few air miles .
in other news , we get uk trade date at 9.30am gmt , and the us unemployment data at 1.30pm gmt .
i 'll be tracking all the main events as they occur
